experience: You and Juan (Alex) both know Peter Reno, Jim Skidmore, and 51 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
Juan (Alex) worked at Charles Schwab before you started
Responsible for build, continuous integration, and continuous delivery and infrastructure automation infrastructure.

Responsible for providing overall strategy for release deployment automation, managing day-to-day implementation of continuous integration implementation, continuous delivery, and DevOps across the entire product delivery enterprise. Provided tactical guidance and direction for release deployment for all customer facing web applications across all test and production environments. Accomplishments include:•	Worked with team members to design and implement infrastructure and application configuration management automation for all test and production environments supporting Schwab.com. Improving the deployment of application release times from hours to under 30 minutes•	Designed and implemented release cycle enhancements, reducing the time to deliver releases for Schwab.com from 6 to 4 weeks, and providing a more efficient interface for all Scrum teams to contribute changes to each release•	Designed and implemented a branching scheme for a number of (20+) Java applications, enabling greater efficiency and compliance for the delivery of enhancements to hundreds of investment managers•	Conducted successful Puppet proof of concept to automate the provisioning and configuration of the build infrastructure

Responsible for supporting build, deployment, and configuration to all test and production environments for multiple types of applications. Co-owner of all branching, merging, build, and deployment practices. Accomplishments include:•	Responsible for the successful configuration of servers and application deployment to a new virtual infrastructure for a large web farm supporting tens of thousands of customers a day•	Led Deployment and Configuration Management team in providing build and deployment services for a complex suite of applications including web, database, console, and desktop applications across multiple development organizations both on Linux and Windows. Promoted to Technical Director in 2010•	Design an implemented branching and merging scheme and process for Schwab.com, supporting over 60 developers over 3 geographic locations (San Francisco, Austin, and Bangalore)

Responsible for the successful implementation of a number of projects in various organizations in the Schwab Investor Services Technology organization, including the Project Management Team, Voice Technology team, and customer email organization. Accomplishments include:•	Managed the successful migration of the Schwab’s voice response units (VRUs) to a new order and trading platform representing savings of thousands of dollars for the firm and included new functionality for VRU users•	Managed complete rewrite of all of the routing rules to support the firms new service product offering Personal Choice Call. The firm’s complete redesign of all core service offering to clients•	Managed the redesign of Schwab’s electronic confirm notifications and end of day summary positions summary (My Closing Summary)•	Managed the implementation of electronic trade notifications

Responsible for the installation, upgrade and maintenance of all StoryServer (content management system) environments (development, testing and production) for schwab.com. Accomplishments include:•	Packaged and installed weekly releases of content and functionality to schwab.com•	Provided developer and production support with StoryServer issues•	Established processes to improve success rate of StoryServer releases. Increasing successful content pushes from around 50% to over 90%•	Redesigned the StoryServer production architecture to enable independent releases to each data center improving resilience and availability

summary: Engineer with more than 15 years of experience, specializing in Software Build, Release and DevOps Engineering, and Configuration Management.  Widely recognized for successfully automating the configuration and deployment of Charles Schwab’s web trading server farm, the company’s single largest revenue generating platform.  Engineering with hot passion.SKILLS AND PROFICIENCIESTechnical -• Scripting: Perl 5, Python, and various Linux/Unix shells, Windows PowerShell, and the Batch language• Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), eXtensible Markup Language (XML), JavaScript, Cascading Style Sheets  • Database: Oracle RDBMS, MySQL, SQL Server• Web and Application Servers: IBM IHS Web Server, WebSphere Application Server, Apache Web Server, and Internet Information Server (IIS) 6.x and 7.x• TCP/IP networking  	• Systems Administration:  Ubuntu, Debian, CentOS, RedHat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), Windows, etc.• Build and Continuous Integration Tools: Jenkins CI, Maven, SonarQube, Nexus, and Team Foundation Sever (TFS) Team Build• Configuration Management: Puppet, infrastructure as code • Version Control Tools: Git, Team Foundation Server, Subversion, and ClearCaseProject Management -• Scrum and the Rational Unified Process• Project Management Institute best practices• Microsoft Office Project and Team Foundation Server Agile Planning tool• Scrum Master certification• Certified to mentor and coach Agile teams
